intro: Sarcoglottis tenuis, commonly known as the slender sarcoglottis, is a climbing vine belonging to the family Aristolochiaceae. It is characterized by its slender, twining stems and heart-shaped leaves with a velvety texture. The plant produces showy, fragrant flowers that are typically greenish-yellow with a distinctive, intricate pattern. It is native to tropical regions of Central and South America, where it thrives in humid, shaded environments. Due to its ornamental value and medicinal properties, it is occasionally cultivated in botanical gardens and traditional herbal practices.
